intro: Eriospermum abyssinicum, commonly known as the Abyssinian eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a short, woody stem with narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in a head, typical of the Asteraceae family. Eriospermum abyssinicum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
